thread.title: Five things to do this week, October 11
thread.title_full: Five things to do this week, October 11

author: WMNGAdams
title: Five things to do this week, October 11
text:
Five things to do this week, October 11 By WMNGAdams | Posted: October 11, 2015 Tavistock Goose Fair Five things to do this week, October 11 X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
1. TAVISTOCK GOOSE FAIR, DEVON, October 14 
Tavistock Goose Fair in West Devon dates back to the early 12th century, and has been a fixture in the calendar since then. 
More recently the emphasis had moved away from livestock, with the Goose Fair focus falling firmly on the fun fair and the phalanx of traders from across the country who descend on the town selling a wide range of goods. 
Now that is changing, with livestock and local produce making a comeback thanks to the annual open day at Tavistock Livestock Centre on Goose Fair day, which this year is on October 14. 
2. SENSATIONAL 60'S EXPERIENCE, HALL FOR CORNWALL, TRURO, October 14 
Step back in time and relive the original classics such as, I'm into Something Good, Out Of Time, Everlasting Love, Bend Me, Shape Me, Young Girl plus many more, performed by five of the most influential artists of the 60's. 
Starring Chris Farlowe, Herman's Hermits, Steve Ellis (voice of Love Affair) New Amen Corner, Union Gap UK and hosted by Alan Mosca from Freddie & The Dreamers. 
Visit www.hallforcornwall.co.uk 
3. TWO MOORS FESTIVAL, DARTMOOR AND EXMOOR, October 15 to October 25 
Two Moors Festival celebrates its 15th anniversary with a star studded line up of musicians and singers, many of whom have played with the world's best orchestras and at major concert halls all over the world. 
A real coup for the festival this year is a 70th birthday recital by Russian pianist Elisabeth Leonskaja, one of the last of the great Russian School. She will be joined by the Doric String quartet and double bass player Leon Bosch for works by Mozart, Schumann and Schubert at All Saints Church in Dulverton on Sunday, October 25. 
For information about all the concerts and how to book, please visit www.thetwomoorsfestival.com 
4. CIDER AND APPLE FESTIVAL, KILLERTON HOUSE, DEVON, October 17 and 18 
Months of apple picking across all 500 acres of orchards on the Killerton estate culminates in a two day family festival to mark National Apple Day. 
Sparrow Park orchard is festooned with bunting, stalls are scattered between the apple trees, and live music drifts in and out of the shade. The amazing smell of a traditional hog roast will greet you at the gate, tempting you to try all sorts of tasty local food produced right here on the Killerton estate. 
Live music will conjure up a magical atmosphere and will have you dancing round the apple trees. A juggler and magician will entertain the crowds on his unicycle and Killerton cider bar will be serving up the estate's award-winning cider, cider cocktails and mulled cider. 
Tradition is at the heart of the weekend, with traditional orchard management, cider production and conservation all being celebrated. You can even bring a small bag of your own garden apples to press into a bottle of juice to take home or follow the orchard trail to witness a 200 year old farm press and a piece of history in action. 
A local tree nursery will be selling fruit trees and offering specialist advice for home growing. 
5. PLYMOUTH INTERNATIONAL BOOK FESTIVAL, DEVON, October 15 to 21 
The Plymouth International Book Festival is back once again, bringing words and books to life across Plymouth. It will unite local and global authors in a celebration of writing and reading for everyone to enjoy. 
The 2015 programme includes exciting new novels from bestselling authors Simon Scarrow and Judy Finnigan, spoken word from the entertaining John Hegley, and a Writing for Radio workshop from the multitalented Paul Dodgson and Edson Burton. 
Visit www.plymouthinternationalbookfestival.com
